pullRequest.body:
helps with reasoning about CFGs with a language of the empty set

### PR summary [01780c9abd](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/21585/commits/01780c9abdae85bc60c6eb181c20a6bba45be938)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ Produces.exists_nonterminal_input_mem`
`+ Rewrites.nonterminal_input_mem`
`+ derives_iff_eq_or_head`
`+ derives_iff_eq_or_tail`
`+ derives_nonterminal`
`+ language_eq_zero_of_forall_input_ne_initial`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>
Please merge `master` into your branch. In the meanwhile, we have removed the `uN` crap.
ðŸš€ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by YaelDillies.

Thanks!

maintainer delegate
Very nice!

Thanks!

maintainer delegate
Note: I switched eq_or_tail from `u = w` to `w = u`: it better follows the convention of `ReflTransGen.cases_tail`. I have little idea why the original PR deviated from this.
Thanks!
I'd rather see `g` implicit (and perhaps `u` and `v` implicit as well) and `h` renamed to `hg` or `hguv` here.
I'd rather see `g` and `t` implicit and `h` renamed to `hg` or `hgt` here.
I'd rather see `g` implicit and `h` renamed to `hg` here.
I am a bit confused by the indentation here.
If you want, you can remove the inner brackets; they are right-associative.
Can `by contradiction` by replaced by a term easily?
I think `{g : ContextFreeGrammar T}` is already in the context.

```suggestion
lemma Rewrites.nonterminal_input_mem : r.Rewrites u v â†’ .nonterminal r.input âˆˆ u := by
```

```suggestion
lemma derives_iff_eq_or_head {u w : List (Symbol T g.NT)} :
```

```suggestion
lemma derives_iff_eq_or_tail {u w : List (Symbol T g.NT)} :
```

```suggestion
lemma Produces.exists_nonterminal_input_mem {u v : List (Symbol T g.NT)} (hguv : g.Produces u v) :
    âˆƒ r âˆˆ g.rules, .nonterminal r.input âˆˆ u := by
```

```suggestion
lemma language_eq_zero_of_forall_input_ne_initial (hg : âˆ€ r âˆˆ g.rules, r.input â‰  g.initial) :
```

```suggestion
    g.language = 0 := by ext; simp +contextual [derives_nonterminal, hg]
```

```suggestion
  simp +contextual [rewrites_iff, List.append_assoc]
```

pullRequest.title: feat(Computability/CFG): lemmas about nonterminals
